title: Hand Gesture Recognition
description: Built real-time hand gesture recognition with hybrid LSTM + XGBoost architecture. Led data collection and MVP development.
challenge: Building real-time gesture recognition required robust hand keypoint detection, temporal pattern recognition, and low-latency inference for interactive applications across varying hand sizes and lighting conditions.
solution: Implemented hybrid approach combining LSTM for temporal sequence modeling with XGBoost for spatial feature classification. Led data collection with coordinated participants and created comprehensive data capture guidelines.
technical: Architecture: MediaPipe for 21-point hand keypoint detection, LSTM for temporal analysis, XGBoost for gesture classification. Real-time optimization: 30+ FPS on edge devices using TensorRT. Data pipeline: 100+ gesture videos with augmentation.
results: 95%+ accuracy across 10+ gestures. Real-time performance: 30+ FPS. MVP successfully demonstrated with 99% reliability in interactive media player control.

title: VLM-OCR Product
description: Led team to fine-tune Vision-Language Models with zero-error inference system for major education company.
challenge: Traditional OCR struggled with complex documents and domain-specific text. Needed zero-error inference for critical financial documents from major education company with hallucination mitigation.
solution: Fine-tuned Vision-Language Models on customer-specific datasets combining synthetic and real data. Developed verification framework using traditional OCR methods to detect and mitigate hallucinations.
technical: Fine-tuned BERT encoder with visual ResNet backbone. Custom attention for cross-modal alignment. Synthetic data generation for domain adaptation. Verification pipeline using multiple OCR methods. AWS deployment with monitoring.
results: Zero-error inference deployed in production. 99.95% confidence on all predictions. Domain adaptation improved accuracy by 30%. Production-grade system for major education company.

title: Japanese License Plate Recognition
description: Led design and deployment achieving 99.8% accuracy for major parking operator nationwide deployment.
challenge: License plate recognition required handling varying formats, weather conditions, occlusion, and lighting. Needed 99%+ accuracy for police department deployment across Japan with tier-1 operator.
solution: Designed multi-stage deep learning pipeline: YOLOv8 for plate detection, ResNet with attention for character recognition, LSTM for sequence correction. Led team through design and deployment.
technical: Stage 1: YOLOv8 for plate localization. Stage 2: ResNet-34 + Attention for character recognition. Stage 3: LSTM for sequence correction. Training data: 100K real + 200K synthetic plates. TensorRT optimization: 500+ plates/minute.
results: 99.8% character-level accuracy achieved. Deployed to 50+ police stations nationwide. 500+ plates/minute processing capacity. False positive rate < 0.1%.

title: Automatic Parking System
description: Directed keypoint prediction models for autonomous parking with engagement from major automotive OEMs.
challenge: Autonomous parking required precise keypoint and line prediction in real-world conditions with varying camera angles, lighting, and parking configurations. 100% reliability needed for commercial deployment.
solution: Developed keypoint detection model trained on 100K synthetic scenarios. Implemented uncertainty estimation for safety. Supervised data pipeline with synthetic generation, labeling tools, and sampling strategies.
technical: HRNet backbone for multi-scale extraction. 16 keypoint predictions per frame. Synthetic data augmentation and domain randomization. TensorRT optimization for real-time inference. Integration with path planning.
results: 100% success rate in 20+ real-world demos. 98.5% detection accuracy. 60 FPS on edge hardware. Engagement from major Japanese automotive OEMs. Commercial-ready system.

title: OCR Product Platform
description: Managed end-to-end OCR product with multiple customer deployments. Built MLOps pipelines and production systems.
challenge: Building end-to-end OCR platform for multiple customers with diverse document types. Required MLOps infrastructure and rapid model iteration.
solution: Developed modular OCR architecture supporting multiple document types. Implemented MLOps pipeline with MLflow and DVC for experiment tracking. Created PyQt5 GUI for data labeling and model evaluation.
technical: Multi-task architecture: text detection, recognition, and verification. MLflow for experiment tracking and model registry. DVC for data versioning. PyQt5 annotation tool. Docker containerization for deployment. AWS SageMaker integration.
results: Successfully deployed to 5+ enterprise customers. Reduced model iteration time by 40%. Automated data pipeline processes. Achieved 95%+ accuracy across diverse document types.

title: ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance)
description: Led 8-engineer team delivering perception systems to tier-1 automotive suppliers with 50% experiment cycle improvement.
challenge: Developing perception systems for ADAS required handling diverse weather conditions, real-time constraints, and integration with automotive-grade hardware. Team scaling and experiment management were critical challenges.
solution: Built scalable MLOps infrastructure with MLflow and Weights & Biases. Established standardized experiment protocols. Implemented automated model optimization pipeline for TensorRT deployment.
technical: Object detection framework: YOLOv8 backbone with custom heads. Real-time optimization: post-training quantization and pruning. MLflow for centralized experiment tracking. Weights & Biases for team collaboration. TensorRT optimization for tier-1 hardware.
results: 50% reduction in experiment cycle time. Successfully deployed to tier-1 automotive suppliers. Team grown from 3 to 8 engineers. Models achieving 95%+ mAP on diverse datasets. 40 FPS inference on automotive hardware.
